evaluate-condition.description: Evaluate the properties, e.g. speed > 5. Note that we only support one level of brackets.

inside-condition.description: Geo-fence: check whether the updated feature, or the feature with ID featureId, is inside the area.

featureId.description: ID of the feature that must be checked whether it is inside the area.

polyId.description: ID of the feature that represents the polygon area (geo-fence).

static.description: When true, the polygon ID represents a static area, resulting in slightly optimized code.

nearby-condition.description: Check whether the updated feature is near the point.

distance.description: Distance to the reference location in units

locationId.description: ID of the feature that represents the reference point.

locationLatLng.description: Specifies the reference location in latitude and longitude.

static.description: When true, the polygon ID represents a static area, resulting in slightly optimized code.

units.description: Specifies the unit type in which the distance is measured.

method.description: Name of the method to execute at the receiver.

oneOf.description: Attach either the complete feature, its properties or geometry to the message.
Alternatively, you can also provide an attached object.

message.description: Message to show in the client.

publisher.description: The publisher type - may be superfluous after renaming the method to sendImbMessage.

description: Describes a rule, which consists of zero or more conditions that must be evaluated to true in order to trigger the one or more actions

actions.description: An array of actions: each action is executed when the rule is triggered.

delayInMSec.description: Delay in milliseconds before triggering the action.

actions.title: Actions schema.

activatedAt.description: The time the rule is activated.

activationType.description: Determines when the rule should be activated / triggered.

conditions.description: An array of AND conditions: each condition must be evaluated to true in order to trigger the actions in the rule.
conditions.title: Conditions schema.

description.description: Description of the rule's purpose. Solely used for documentation purposes.
description.title: Description schema.

featureId.description: Feature (ID) this rule applies too. If the featureId is specified, the rule is not generic.

isActive.description: A rule may start active, meaning it will be evaluated every time, or inactive, waiting for activation to occur.
isActive.title: IsActive schema.

isGeneric.description: If true, indicates that we are dealing with a rule that is not bound to a specific feature, but applied to all.

recurrence.description: How often may the rule fire. In case the value is -1, fire continuously.
recurrence.title: Recurrence schema.

title: Rule schema.
